Any ideas? Thank you.
Malakore what are you talking about, you have this torrent confused with another...

Can you please tell me how to remove whatever "crack" this torrent uses?  I installed this first so I could try out the game and then decided I liked it.  So I purchased the legit version to support the developers and connect to real multiplayer servers.

Of course now when I try to login to my legit copy it says "Login Failed".  Which I'm assuming is because this torrent does something,  and doesn't reverse it when you use the uninstaller that is included.

I already tried deleting the .minecraft folder.   The web browser version works for me and installs the legit files,  so then I can use the desktop version and do "Play offline" once the login fails.

BUT I cannot login... thats the issue.  PLEASE HELP!

"C:UsersMyUserNameAppDataRoaming.minecraftMinecraft Launcher.jar"

I also tried manually going into the minecraft folder and opening it with the same result. It opens another application. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

I can't get it to work at all. It opens a different and completely unrelated application. It seems to be similar to TerrydaSauce's issue. I have checked the shortcut's target location and everything is correct and the files are there, but it opens something else. If anyone has encountered this and corrected it help would be appreciated.

@TeamExtremeMC
I'm having the problem where the minecraft shortcut brings up the "open with which program" issue and i tried setting it to run with java but that doesn't work, also java wasn't on the program list so i had to find it manually. I tried changing file extensions to .exe as well, is "minecraft launcher.jar" even supposed to open the game?
also i tried installing your 1.3 version and that one at least had the minecraft icon but still the same problem, is there not supposed to be an .exe file?

@Penitence: Verify that your Java is installed properly (you can type  "java -version" in the command line) and then make sure that you open it with Java Web Start (javaw.exe, located in the "bin" directory of your Java install).

@TeamExtremeMc
I've already done that and everything points me to drivers...And i've done what everybody says but still nothing... :P

@Malakore
thanks for responding but i had already tried javaw.exe i saw it mentioned on another forum but it still did not help, regardless TeamExtremeMc's newest update of Minecraft seems to start off without the problems i previously encountered, might just be a rare problem on my account
so main screen of the game,options,i think it was video but some were in opions on bottom of screen red letters telling me too change 64 bit too 32 bit.no more lag works thanks ;-)
